As an AI language model, I do not have access to the latest information about the current state of the Cordillera forests, however, I can provide some general information.

While conservation efforts have been put in place to protect the forests in Cordillera, there are still many challenges that need to be addressed to preserve and restore the forest ecosystem effectively. Illegal logging, mining, and agricultural practices, as well as forest fires and natural disasters, continue to pose significant threats to the region's forests. The effects of climate change, including changes in temperature and rainfall patterns, also have an impact on the health and resilience of the forests in Cordillera.

Despite the challenges faced by the forests in the region, there have been some positive signs of progress. Efforts to reforest and restore degraded areas have been successful, and there are initiatives that involve local communities in forest management and conservation, which have helped to improve the health of forests.

Overall, while conservation efforts have helped to protect and preserve the forests in Cordillera, ongoing efforts are needed to address the various challenges and to sustainably manage and restore the region's forest ecosystem.
